stories.title: Show HN: Tracking free, FOSS, URL shortener

stories.text:
Medium turned off my Medium Partner Program access without warning! Looking at their current live policy, it appears I'm below their 'following' count threshold they've implemented after I joined, so perhaps this was an automated task they've actioned to backwards-apply the rules. Surprised there was no warning...

Anyone else experienced this?

Leaves me convinced that you cannot treat a single platform as a reliable source of income, only ever passive or grouped with many providers.

This won't stop me posting on Medium, as it's a great platform to share technical knowledge with others.
stories.title: Ask HN: Anyone else had their Medium Partner Program turned off this week?
TweetDeck may become a paid Twitter Blue option
We Are Qualitatively Different from Other Species
You will notice that a time-travel option is not included on this model

stories.text: Hi HN, I work in a busy, fast changing environment. I'm in a pretty senior role there reporting directly to the CEO. I have always had more work than my team could possibly complete,  and coped ok with that.  What is getting me stressed is the toxic culture from the top. My boss spends his day setting unrealistic ecpectations, blaming me for every setback, refusing to listen to logic or reason.  I'm now off sick with serious stress symptoms. I want to stop feeling sorry for myself and get better.  Apart from resigning I feel like learning to not care so much might help. Can anyone share any resources that helped them combat work place stress,  and particularly any that helped them care less about the hurtful things said to them?
stories.title: Ask HN: Dealing with Workplace Stress
